This is an attempt to enumerate who is paying or what.







Item
funding source

Handong U


Prince CC (and breakfast)
DVI


Lunches on Sat/Sun

Dinners on Sat/Sun



Lunches Mon-Fri (dining hall)
DVI


Dinner Monday



Dinner Tuesday
SCIO (pending confirmation from Arlene)


Dinner Wednesday



Lunch/refrheshments Wed
Vos


Dinner Thursday
SCIO (pending confirmation from Arlene) or Vos


Dinner Friday



Excursions (if any)





Funding Sources

DVI
SCIO – for expenses related to bring FEN people to talk students
Vos – must relate to faculty development and involve Math/Stat
Math/Stat research overhead
Math/Stat “department fund”
Collaboration grant – funds available for post workshop dinner that we haven’t used yet
Other?

title: Handong U / Calvin U exchange
text: This site has some information related to a 2026 faculty exchange between Handong University in Pohang, South Korea and Calvin University in Grand Rapids, MI. This is a Quarto website.

title: Itinerary for Visit to Calvin
text:
Some notes about the schedule:

This is a draft and subject to change. In particular, we are waiting for some input from Joseph Cho and Hangin Lee about their preferences.
Items in italics are options we can decide about.
Items that are struck through are also options, but I’m assuming they won’t happen unless I get feedback to the contrary.
Items in bold are planned, but they can be removed or adjusted as desired.
Jim VanderMay is currently scheduled for Thursday mid-day. It is possible that might move to Tuesday. If so, we can swap some things between those two days.
Once we confirm a few more details I’ll start the process of finding out who is available for various meals.
I expect we will have someone from Calvin available to do airport pickup and drop-off. (Detailed flight info would be good so they can monitor the flight status.)
There are a couple more things I’m trying to schedule – I’m hoping on Monday morning.
It would be good to get the details about Joseph’s and Hanjin’s presentations sorted soon so we can publicize them.




Joseph Arrives at GRR (late evening), transport to Prince CC

Flight info:






Hanjin arrives at GRR (22:47), transport to Prince CC

Flight info:

Joseph and his wife may spend day with Soyeon Chun



Note: RJP is likely not available most of Saturday

Visit CS 384 (Prespectives)  leave early for lunch in dining hall with TBD?


12:15 - 13:55
Stat 245: Jim VanderMey Making the Invisible Visible: Ethics, Systems, and the Future We’re Building In a world increasingly shaped by data, design, and automation, the deepest ethical decisions are often the ones we never see — embedded in architecture, algorithms, and assumptions. In this keynote, Jim VanderMey draws on decades of real-world practice as a technologist and his formation in theology to explore how we can surface these hidden choices, provide ethical leadership in a pluralistic society, and anticipate the long-term consequences of what we build — before they are felt.


14:10 - 15:00
Informal discussion with Jim VanderMey (with refreshments) prep for colloquium


15:05 - 15:50
Math/Stat Colloquium


17:00 - 18:30
Dinner (with Jim VanderMey?); location TBD
